titlestmt.titleproper: Inventory of the Don Amador Papers 1970-1983
titlestmt.subtitle: Amador, Don Papers Mss. Acc. 2009.562

profiledesc.creation: Finding aid created by Ute Schechter, 2009

frontmatter.titlepage:
Inventory of the Don Amador Papers, 1970-1983 A Collection in the
Special Collections Research Center Mss. Acc. 2009.562
Earl Gregg Swem Library, College of William and Mary 2012 &contact;
Processed By
Special Collections Staff.

archdesc.runner: Special Collections, Earl Gregg Swem Library, College of William and Mary

did.head: Overview of the Collection
did.abstract: Papers of gay rights activist Don Amador of Los Angeles. Included are personal papers, papers relating to research and teaching, as well as papers relating to his political activities.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Collection is open to all researchers.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Before reproducing or quoting from any materials, in whole or in part, permission must be obtained from the Special Collections Research Center, and the holder of the copyright, if not Swem Library.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Don Amador Papers, Special Collections Research Center, Swem Library, College of William and Mary.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: The materials were acquired by Special Collections Research Center on 12/02/2009.

appraisal.head: Appraisal Information
appraisal.p: One cubic foot of newspapers were deaccessioned as the originals were damaged by mildrew and potential mold and there were multiple copies of many papers.

custodhist.head: Custodial History
custodhist.p: After the death of Don Amador the papers were in the custody of his sister in Troy, N.Y.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Accessioned and minimally processed in December 2009 by Ute Schechter, Warren E. Burger Archivist.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Further information about this individual or organization may be available in the Special Collections Research Center Wiki:http://scrc.swem.wm.edu/wiki/index.php/Don_Amador.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Papers of gay rights activist Don Amador of Los Angeles. Included are personal papers, papers relating to research and teaching, as well as papers relating to his political activities.

arrangement.head: Arrangement of Materials
arrangement.p: This collection is not yet fully arranged and described. Researchers may wish to consult with a staff member for further information in advance of using the collection.

controlaccess.head: Index Terms
controlaccess.p: This Collection is indexed under the following controlled access subject terms.
